snippet: Lucian A. Bebchuk, a Harvard law professor, contends that bonuses for Wall Street’s top executives should be linked to the value of a firm’s bonds as well as stock to align the managers’ interests with those of all stakeholders.
lead_paragraph: Lucian A. Bebchuk, a professor of law, economics and finance at Harvard, contends that bonuses for Wall Street’s top executives should be linked to the value of a firm’s bonds as well as stock to align the interests of managers with those of everyone who holds a stake in the firm, Bloomberg News reports.

headline.main: Wall St. Urged to Tie Bonuses to Debt of Banks
